name: Melanie Williams
text: I had a positive experience prior so hired Kevin again. I tried to reach him to make things right and could not reach him via phone or text. My flooring was cut incorrectly. I have numerous spots where you can see the slab. Toilets were not correctly re-installed. House was left a total mess. Floors were filthy, grout and sand and debris left in my sinks and tubs. Trim was not replaced where it belonged. Hole was made in my bedroom wall, was repaired, not great. I felt I was taken advantage of regarding charges to remove subfloor. I questioned the high rate and was told it was because it could take days, it took hours yet I wasn’t offered any relief.

name: Alex
text: Kevin is prompt and very professional. He arrived on time and notified me in advance when he would be here and what he would be doing. He tore out my old plastic master shower and tiled in a beautiful new one for me. The only negative is my water bill is going to go up because I love my shower now.10/10 highly recommended for tile in shower work.

We are very happy with how our floors turned out and will definitely be calling WCR in the future.

I highly recommend calling 9-1 Plumb for any issues.

name: Glen Deal
text:
I called 9-1 Plumb on a Tuesday and made an after hours appointment for Thursday (all they had available at the time). I told the "dispatcher" Renee (sp?) that I had a water meter ripped out of the ground by Hurricane Sally and that I needed new meter re-installed in ground, hooked and entire new line ran to house. Requested that if anything opened up between Tuesday and Thursday to notify me.

Thursday morning Brent contacted me and said he would scope out the job and call me back. Within 15 minutes he called with a description and plan to solve the issue and that his crew (Drew and Nolan) could be onsite within an hour or so and complete the entire job by end of day.

Drew and Nolan arrived as scheduled with all necessary equipment (to include trencher) to complete the job and restore services to my home.

All of the members of 9-1 Plumb, Brent, Drew, Nolan and Renee were exceptionally professional, friendly, timely and most of all - customer service oriented.

I couldn't have asked for better.

We very much appreciate their work and most highly recommend them!!!! They will be my first call for any future issues!!!!

name: Mitch Pinkston
text:
If you are looking for a fair, honest, and professional plumber, call 9-1 Plumb.

Brent, the master plumber, explains every step of the repair process, and he ensures that the job is done in a timely fashion.  Due to poor pipes used by the homebuilder 10 years ago, our house experienced multiple leaks last fall.  Brent responded within a couple of hours of our call and was able to locate and repair the issues.  Eventually, 9-1 Plumb completed a re-pipe of our house.  We received multiple bids, and they completed the re-pipe in a quick and clean manner while also being the most cost-effective option for me.

This week our original grinder pump stopped working when it met its life expectancy (10 years).  Brent thoroughly checked every part of the grinder pump system to try to find the least costly repair.  Unfortunately, the pump was shot and a replacement was needed.  Brent was able to have a new pump and assembly installed the very next day.

I will call Brent at 9-1 Plumb for all of my plumbing needs.

name: David Chew
text: We had a clogged toilet drain in our master bath. It has been backing up about once a month for a while. These guys came in and got to work right away. They did not stop until the drain was clear. They went through the toilet first, then the sink, then the shower, and then back through the toilet, and then up through the clean out located on the outside of the house. After all of that they went back to their office and pick up the "BIG" machine. Once they got back they ran it once through the toilet drain where it ran into the clog and cut through the major clog and clearing the pipe. We watched at the outside clean out as the nasty clog pushed on through and out to the sewer. Then we saw nothing but clear water after that. No problems since then.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us such a positive review.  We understand our customers concerns and try to take care of them in a professional and timely manner.  We are here if you need us.

name: Samantha Pinkston
text: I can't say enough good things about Brent and D.  I called 9-1 Plumb when we had water coming up through our hardwood floor. The dispatcher initially said they wouldn't be able to get to us until the next day, but called when they had an opening later in the day since I had mentioned I wanted same day. We had a different plumber out earlier who told us at best we were going to need a costly repair or at worst would need to redo the plumbing in the entire house.  When the source of the leak wasn't obvious, Brent was thorough in figuring out what was actually leaking and was able to do the repair easily and for a very reasonable price. 9-1-Plumb saved us thousands of dollars. I highly recommend and will use them for all our future plumbing needs.

name: Georgia Brown
text: I would highly recommend this company!! I had what I thought was a leaking water heater in my rental house. Water was getting under the laminate flooring. I called Doug after hours. He answered promptly and answered all my questions and said he could come the next day. My renter and I had shut off and drained the water heater. He was there at the time he promised with his co worker Jeff.  They discovered I actually had a slab leak! He gave me a quote that was much less than I expected and said they could start the next day. Brent and Jake came the next morning on time and ready to work. They worked all day with only a short break. They were courteous and professional and also very neat and respectful and careful not to disturb my renter's personal belongings. The job was a 2 day job and they came first thing the next morning to complete their work and worked this day until they finished without taking a break. They showed and explained to me everything they had done. You could hardly tell there had been any work done at all, everything was so clean!! Sorry to write a book, but having these guys do this job made a very stressful situation much less so!! I can't praise them enough and they will definitely get my business in the future!!  Georgia B.  Fairhope, Al

The first time he repaired a leak in the laundry room behind our washer which caused flooding into our kitchen. He responded quickly, after hours (at night on a weekend), and dina great job.

Today we called on him again to install a garbage disposal in our kitchen and check a leak behind our master bathroom toilet. The disposal was easy, but the bathroom was a bit trickier since he didn't know what he would find behind the wall. He walked me through the steps he was taking and provided a price range based on what he might find once he got started which was helpful. (That way we knew what the high end might be if damage was extensive or the repair was more complex than anticipated.) Thankfully, it wasn't as bad as it could have been and itwas easily fixed in one visit.

The 9-1 team is on time, professional, and affordable. Doug and his team were also very clean while working on the repairs which was much appreciated. I'd strongly reccomend the 9-1 team to anyone in the area looking for a reliable plumbing team.

You can ask for the showroom manager during normal business hours; M-F from 9:00 to 4:30. Thank you.

text: This store looked great! My sis and I had a great time walking around looking at all the treasures that Home Goods has to offer. Its literally a treasure hunt. One could browse this store for hours. The employees do a great job keeping this Home Goods location organized. There are plenty of good finds for all ages.

The locations observes Covid safety measures.

Location currently has a good select of inventory. Staff seems to replenish inventory as it becomes available. *Friendly suggestion* if you see something you like, BUY IT THEN! (Most inventory doesn't last long and is RARELY duplicated)

Location is neat and orderly, however navigation in the aisles can become congested if directional floor signage not observed.

Staff is friendly, helpful and professional.

Overall, it was a pleasant shopping experience.

text: Awesome furniture and lighting. It’s a little pricey but great quality. The only downside to this location is that it is quite small with not much to see on display. There weren’t many employees available to offer assistance or answer questions. I highly recommend visiting the multi level Nashville location if you want a better experience.

name: SantanaTyree
text:
SAVE YOURSELF THE TIME AND DO NOT GO HERE. See below:

The customer service was absolutely awful. If you are looking for a warm, inviting environment, RH at the Summit isn’t the place whatsoever. You will be completely disappointed if you receive the treatment we did. You will especially be disappointed and appalled if you had just left Bassett Furniture in Hoover where they took the time to do the following: cultivate a relationship, show you around their showroom, listen to what your needs are, and sit down to customize furniture based on your specifications. For lack of words, the feeling that my husband and I received at RH: “We are RH, our products speak for themselves, so we are not going to do our job at all. We are not going to try to educate them on our selections/options. I am not leaving my computer to assess their needs. If they want something, they’ll ask me then buy it.” The ONLY information we were given was about looking online and a RH book when we got ready to leave because I couldn’t take it any longer. Not once did the lady offer to look at fabrics with us, to go over color selections, discuss what their process was, etc. (We were wanting custom furniture for a spec home and this was stated.) When I asked a question, the response was very much short and NON-informative, I was told to look online which defeats the entire purpose of going in store. The lack of willingness to assist us has left a LASTING impression. Because of that, we are HAPPY to spend MORE elsewhere because of superb customer service. There are numerous competitors; a product can easily be mimicked, customer service can’t.

name: Vicki Dukes
text: I had been looking for a table and chairs for my kitchen. Found what I wanted online. I wasn’t ready to order, though, without seeing it. My husband and I made the 1.5 hour trip to Bham. I had talked to Loren on the phone before I came. When we got there, Loren helped us. She was very professional and knew what she was talking about. It was a very good experience.

name: Brian Panos
text: Nice stuff but pricey!

name: Jennifer Jones
text: Thank God for Rebekah!! I visited RH for the first time on 10/26 during my quick little birthday getaway. This was actually my first time EVER visiting an RH store. Rebekah greeted me enthusiastically. She was so nice and personable as she engaged with me and answered any and all questions that I had. I really enjoyed chatting with her. She was very cheerful, bubbly, and helpful. I really didn't sense the same vibe from the other few associates I saw standing around in the store. The guy who greeted me at the door was also warm ams and inviting. Thank you soooo much Rebekah for being so friendly and kind!!! Little did she know, I had just lost one of my closest friends to Covid-19 who was buried just that Saturday before. So, I was out and about trying to enjoy my birthday in spite of. This was my first visit to the Summit, and Rebekah was one the best experiences I had that day. She really need to spend time over at Saks and Seasons 52 training some of the sales associates and waiters on good customer service and how to demonstrate it. God bless you Rebekah!!

name: ivo horak
text: Bought a cloud with terrible cushions that don’t hold their fill just after a single use.   There is no way a cushion should have to be disconnected and fluffed every single time.    Now they told me that it would cost $1400 to replace them to cushions  that will hold their shape.   Extremely disappointed with a multi million dollar company that can’t remedy a simple problem.

She is not only a pleasure to work with, she is friendly and helpful and always puts customer first.  She has went out of her way to make sure we are happy and love our furniture - both inside furniture and outside.  Thank you Rebecca.

name: Susan Hanley
text: If you could assign less than one star I certainly would. I just spent over 20 minutes in Restoration Hardware at the Summit waiting for someone to wait on me (or even speak to me) and obviously they do not need my business because they did not even acknowledge me although they looked over at me several times. There were three sales associates and at the very beginning they were each with someone but then one became available when her customer left and she immediately disappeared to the back of the store. Again keep in mind they all saw me and said nothing and when the sales rep  finally came back out from wherever she went, another person  walked into the store and she asked if she could help them. Wow! I wanted to purchase a king bedroom suite I saw in their catalog which would have been well over a $10k purchase but I guess they do not need my business. I’m taking it somewhere that someone will actually acknowledge you  walked into their store.

They were unwilling to replace a defective rug (they deemed it defective) and discount another rug we were willing to buy. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

name: Dr. L. Dansby
text: Horrible customer service. Does not take debit, just cash or check. I had him to give me an estimate on two window squares that were broken out of the window pane. The quote was $135. My neighbor let him in and I was put of town and called to tell him to go ahead and do the work. I did tell him I would mail come over the weekend and drop off, but I couldn't make it due to a flat tire and traffic. I did come to Montgomery early Monday morning to give the check personally because he stated he would do the work monday. I called him to let him know I was in town and ask was he still going to do the work and he was VERY RUDE and stated I didn't leave it in the drop box and he couldn't drop what he was doing and he already scheduled his day. I explained to him traffic was bad and that I chose to come early Monday, bc he was closed the weekend. He stated that traffic was bad in Montgomery and had an attitude.  I told him not like Birmingham and I tried to proceed, but due to his RUDE customer service I wanted to do business elsewhere. I called Lee co and got a cheaper quote for $95, they accepted debit and will be on the way......HE DOESN'T HAVE THE MONOPOLY, COULD HAVE BEEN MORE COURTEOUS  AND UNDERSTANDING EXSPECIALLY WHEN PEOPLE ARE TRYING TO SPEND THEIR MONEY.

name: Lester Williams
text: Very Good glass Co

name: david schofield
text: Horrible customer service.

name: Krissi Harpel
text: All the reviews were great so I was excited to get started with this company.  Their representative came to the house and brought a contractor, I was told it would take about a week to generate an estimate of materials.  During that week I sent some colors I liked and a couple of questions and I was not getting any response from the designer .  Once the week was up I sent an email to the designer and told her I needed someone who was going to be responsive to emails .  She immediately responded saying that she could not get my cabinets to meet our timeline and I would have to find someone else ...which if she had paid attention I had asked for an estimate on painting and replacing .  I then left a message for someone from management. to call me and got no response.  Very very disappointing

resp.text: I spoke with Krissi and explained a few items to her concerning her project and attempted to assist her with her project even though Coastal is not performing the project.  Hopefully this will help.  We do not paint cabinets and recommend under normal conditions that this not be done.  Typically, a paint job will have to repeated in the near term due to underlying issues with cabinets themselves.

name: Hilton Perry
text: For many months my wife and I  have wanted to remodel our bath but finding some one that was knowledgeable and and responsive was impossible and had almost given up. A friend told us to call  Coastal Kitchen & Bath and with in just a few days we were set up to meet and go over what we wanted and measure. The next week we were picking out the flooring, cabinets and fixtures we wanted. Today we have the bath that we had visioned for moths. Very responsive and courteous.

resp.text: Thanks for the review.  It can be amazing what a kitchen remodel can do for the appearance of your home and your piece of mind.

text: I have had the pleasure of working with Jill here and she is a delight! This company should be proud to have her as an employee. She is very knowledgeable, helpful and very friendly. I will tell everyone I know to make sure to stop in!!!

resp.text: you're going to love your new mud room

name: me to you
text:
The lady, Jill, was very helpful.  If you go there you have to order what you see on display.  Ordering means a 3 or 4 week delay.  They have a variety of everything related to the bathroom.  My apologies because I did not take photos.

My contractor wants it yesterday. Seems the stuff is never there fast enough for them. They want to go to Lowe's, pick it up, and install it the same day.

resp.text: Thanks for the opportunity.  We do not keep cabinets in stock since there are so many options, sizes and colors.  Unfortunately, contractors can experience delays and then want everything yesterday, like you said.

name: Alla Nikitina
text: Out of business

resp.text: Actually, we are not out of business.  We have a new location that we are working on opening up after the Hurricane Sally destruction to our old building but we have been working from remote locations since Sally.  Our website, Facebook page, Pinterest, Google My Business page, etc. all reflect we are open for business and have been open for business.  Our phone number is active as well so feel free to contact us if you have a project you are interested in us quoting for you.  251-943-5358.

name: ted croft
text: They dont stand behind their products! Bought a marble vanity top and they installed two sinks (undermount) and the silicone bled through to the surface of the top and stained it where the silicone was applied for the sinks. The top is ruined! After sending pics Mike told me to call the manufacturer of the silicone to get it fixed or remedied. What terrible customer service. Good thing he sold the company!

resp.text: Ted is correct, the business has been sold to the owner of Folkers Window Company.  The marble vanity top Ted purchased was a old remnant from the warehouse and was "sold as is" for a very cheap price.  Unfortunately with remnants and very low prices, these things happen.  This was communicated to the customer at the time of the sale.  The best way to avoid issues with products and expired warranties is to purchase new products instead of remnants.

name: Anisha Penton
text: Amazing company to work with! Very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff.

resp.text: Great choice with Silestone quartz counter tops

name: Gayle Patterson
text: Jill Kinard is very knowledgeable and helpful.

resp.text: Thanks much.  Hopefully we can assist with your remodeling project

name: Cheryl McCoy
text: Good products, pricey

resp.text: Thanks for the business and the review.  No, we are not the cheapest because as you said "good products".  We do not sell junk and we use professional installers and not sub contractors.  In addition, we use stainless steel fasteners, high grade caulks, etc. all which lead to a higher price and a higher quality installation.  Thus, we will typically not be the cheapest...but we're the best.

name: Cathy Hodo
text: I bought my hot tub about two years ago and it has really been horrible. We can’t get anyone to come service our hot tub in Hoover, Alabama. I had no idea they they would deliver the hot tub and then not have any service for when we had problems. And man have we had problems. No other companies will service it because we didn’t buy it from them. Take my advice and if you live anywhere near Hoover, Alabama buy your hot tub from another company!!!

name: Jim Tate
text: If you want a poor experience, call this outlet in Chattanooga for your hot tub experience.    My wife and I were lied to about everything.    The delivery date was a huge lie and the customer service from the sales rep  (initials JH) was extremely poor and unethical.     No follow up phone calls or emails until my responses via email were extreme and rude because of their lack of care and concern for our purchase.     I don't recommend these guys or the sales guy (JH) to anyone.   He needs to find a new career.

name: Keith Cooper
text: Too pricey better off going online.

name: Phillip McCracken
text: I was a little disappointed at first because the satellite office here in Huntsville doesn't have a complete showroom. But after speaking with Jason, he convinced me it was worth the drive to Chattanooga to see the full showroom and it was. I saved over $5000.00 on my new Catalina Luxury hot tub.

name: Stan Quigley
text: My wife and I found a beautiful hot tub at this place. We both had thought about getting one for years after our last one had too many cracks and repairs to it.  We enjoy going out to our back patio and using the tub almost every night and it has been a blessing for our aches and pains.  I think you will find what you're looking for when you check out their showroom.  Friendly and helpful staff too. We are looking for an infrared sauna and not sure they carry those though.

name: Angela Heard
text: The ABSOLUTELY WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE and HOT TUB.Ordered from Chattanooga TN . Would never ever ever ever ever ever recommend or buy from again. Had a brand new hot tub delivered end of August 2018. By December 2018 the pump went out. Hadn't used the hotub I kid you not no more than 5 times total. Called two weeks ago talk to a tech and claim he was going to order the new pump. Called this morning to check on it and someone else claimed they didn't have any record on it. We knew it wasnt good because it came with the main pipe not put together and the lights not hooked up.

name: Keith Quackenbush
text:
I walked in the showroom and was blown away by the selection.  After I walked in I was sooooo impressed by the service.

What I will say is that this place is not 'cheap'... if you want 'cheap' 99 cent tile or carpet... go somewhere that sells cheap stuff.

BUT! If you want builders grade, or really cool stuff at great low prices.... then they are well worth a visit! Ober 50,000 sample in a gorgous well lit showroom.

BEST flooring, plumbing and cabinet showroom I have ever seen.

text: Overabundance of choices! Jeff was a great help, plus he has a really good eye for color. Can't say enough about this one-stop-shopping hidden gem in Pelham!

Thanks so much for the feedback, We really appreciate you taking the time to leave a review! We pride ourselves on having the best quality materials with plenty of choices and are thrilled to hear you enjoyed working alongside Jeff. Come back anytime!

text: ProSource has been so easy to work with. They give great advice and don't rush like the more well known franchises and big box stores. I will use them again when I do my next renovation.

text:

He had a wealth of knowledge, of all their materials and shared advice on my possible interests.  I was given many samples to take home to see

text: Great store with excellent customer service.  Helpful with great info for us non plumbing types.

name: Joseph Miller
text: This is a great store with excellent customer service. I needed the new Kohler Bellera faucet (K-560 with Docknetik and Sweep spray) and kohler chose not to change model numbers so they could unload remaining inventory. This particular faucet is not available online or lowe's/home depot. The store manager understood exactly what I wanted, ordered exactly what I wanted, walked me through the installation, and was incredibly knowledgable/helpful. He also took the time to help me troubleshoot a shutoff valve problem on another sink. Kohler makes a great product, the faucet is awesome, and this is the place to purchase. Great staff, local business, will definitely use again.

text: Great service, low prices. Ask for Clint!!

text: Was told the faucet I ordered would be there that afternoon or the next morning. Called the next morning and still didn't have my complete order. Come 2 p.m. I decided to stop by the store for a refund due to the fact my plumber would be coming over soon to install it and we still haven't heard anything. They charge a 25% restocking fee for a item that I still haven't received. Don't Promise something you can not fulfill.

name: Deirdre Taylor
text: I only go to home Depot if Lowe's doesn't have what I need, and that's rare. I always have a problem picking up orders. You can't just call in to have it brought to you by curbside because they claim to be too busy to get your information. When you go in, if the order is not in that little closet behind them, they'll just tell you it's not there rather than to go to the back and get it. I order a lot and never have a problem with Lowe's. It took an act of congress to finally get my complete order from Home Depot. One young lady, Kia went out of her way to help me and it wasn't even her department. Thanks to her I have everything. I only shop here when I absolutely have no choice.

name: Silvery Nova
text: The first problem is the delivery service company that Home Depot uses for direct deliveries,Central Transport. My 1st initial delivery date changed three time before it was actually attempted to be delivered on March 3rd. On March 3rd the shipment came on a long bed truck with a pallet dolly. My shipment is a pallet of 33 boxes of porcelain tile., plus 7 additional boxes they put on the same pallet. The right side of the pallet was coming apart due to the immense weight of the tile . The driver could not move the pallet down the truck. He was not going to be able to pull it up the small slope on my driveway. What on earth were they even thinking?They needed a fork lift. I called Home Depot and they got the Transport company on the line while I was on hold. I ended up being told the transport company needed to take care of this and they would contact me in 24 to 48 hours. Which they never did. I had to call them. On 3/5 Friday I called central transport and they told me the shipment would be delivered on Monday between 11 and 12. They never showed. I checked the shipment tracking and found that they changed it to Tuesday 3/9! I got no call, text, or phone call.So Tuesday 3/9 I message them to find out eta. They said the drivers hadn't left yet and to keep checking they will update me. That never happened. So I wait and wait and I get a call from Home Depot letting me know the tile has arrived at THE STORE. I was never told anything about this.They will be delivering the tile on Monday 3/15....

text: Love home depot.. They had alot of stuff at decent prices and the employees were really friendly and helpful. They now have self checkout so checkout was a breeze too. It wasnt crowded and displays made things very easy to find on my own.

name: Sandra Cauley
text:
I went in the garden center and told girl at registry, that  I wanted 2 medium bags of Miracle-Gro potting soil, and help getting it n putting it in car.  No help came, then she told me go in back pick it up.  Finally realized she charged me for garden soil, I ask her to give me potting soil and charge me for the difference.  She said she couldn't, I had go customer service.  I told her I wasn't able, that why I parked out in front garden center and ask for help.  I told her I would eat the loss and never come there again.

I don't like be hard get long with, but it was her mistake, why should I have go customer service, when I have trouble walking that distance.  I will use Lowes from now on.

I'm a 100% Service Connected Disable Veteran.

name: melissa renee
text: The lady who sold us a washer and dryer was very nice no problems at all. I have a problem with the fact that they were supposed to be delivered at my house on April 21st. It got delayed so they moved the delivery date to Today ( April 24th ) but I never got any notification so I called and they told me that they don’t deliver to my area on saturdays, only Wednesdays and they don’t deliver when the weather is rainy. It’s been SUNNY all day. No bad weather AT ALL. Now the delivery date has been moved to May 12th. I will be giving birth in May so that’s really annoying 🙄 I ordered my washer and dryer on MARCH 3RD!!!  I hope the warehouse manager makes this right.

name: Jessie
text: Went to buy an appliance that I saw online. Called the this particular store literally on my way over there. Young lady told me that indeed they had the sale item which I was inquiring about. I get to the store and spoke with someone worker in appliances I ask him again to verify of what I wanted. He walks back and confirms my injury. Rung me up just to realize he mentioned through conversation of the appliance he thought I was asking of. Which I corrected him and pointed out and literally touched again the same appliances that I wanted. Apparently some way some how after all this confusion. They magically had sold out. So my thinking leads me to believe the person I spoke to on the phone didn't bother to check or maybe something with system either way wasted my time and here's the kicker the way the guy tried to put it was like I could go to another home depot after I already paid. Luckily my bank released this debit transaction. Poor poor salesmanship and somewhere along the line communication is lacking. I hope I can revisit this location in the future without this issue.

I actually purchased a pressure washer could not get it to work they sent it off come back and said there was nothing wrong with it I said let's go to the garden center let's hook it up to hose and let's find out ..so finally they agreed after I insisted guess what it didn't work they still wanted $35. name: commonsense forreal
text: Do not buy anything from this home depot, their customer service,  is horrible,  they lie, when assuring they will return your call. If you pay for a job to be done there is no follow up to see if their horrible subcontractors have completed the job, and no one at the home depot is reasonable when its not completed. They get your money up front and you get the run around, October 15th I ordered doors and paid to have them installed, not only was the installation price more than advertised, its Nov 7th and I have the doors sitting in my living room floor, not installed,  but they took my money, so I warn you dont do business with home depot, I wont again.

name: Robyn Curry
text:
**EDIT**
Since the freezer mishap below the management staff (namely Dave) has gone above and beyond to make things right by me. I feel like The Home Depot has redeemed themselves and they have earned my business once again.

I ordered an upright freezer to be delivered to my home. I missed three days of work for no-show deliveries and countless hours on the phone trying to get a freezer delivered and all I got in return was excuses and finger pointing. I had three managers from the West Mobile location involved in this situation (Dave, Cameron, and Jonathan) as well as the customer service help line. They were all aware of the fiasco that had occurred with this delivery yet when I asked what could be done no solution was offered. After a month of no freezer from the Home Depot I cancelled the order and bought one from Lowe’s. I had it the very next day. The Home Depot was always my go-to home improvement store but in light of the lack of customer service in this particular situation I think I’ll reconsider that.

name: Shaun Steffensen
text:
If you order appliances from somewhere, do yourself a favor and not order from Home Depot. First, the people who are selling the appliances do not know much about them. I was told that for installation of my microwave, I needed an outlet in the wall that it was being installed on. Great. I'm good. WRONG!!! The outlet had to be above the microwave.... Something that would have been nice to know, but they could not communicate that properly.
Then, the delivery/installation people had no idea what they were doing. They were more of a delivery company, not an installation professional. They could not install my gas range. They damaged my microwave. So, really, they weren't even a good delivery company. Home Depot just subs out delivery to the cheapest company....and you can see the quality when your damaged items arrive!
And I pray for you if you have ANY problems with your delivery or installation!!!
Count on a couple of things: 1) You will spend hours on the phone getting to talk to the right person. Once you think that you have the right person, they will tell you they have to check on something and they will have to call you back. OR, the right person is "on lunch" and they will call you back. After giving them ample time for "lunch" (3 hours) when you call them back, you will be told that they were "off today" but they will return your call in the morning.
Basically, it's a game of ping-pong and it takes days to get simple questions answered because, obviously, no one who works there wants to actually do anything.
I can't believe I dropped over $7K in there and they can't even answer a simple question!!!!
Buyer beware!!! Shop at Lowe's!!!

text: I ordered $1,600 worth of appliances on black Friday to furnish my investment property. I scheduled them to be delivered on Friday, 12/22, and I was told the delivery time frame would be from 2pm-6pm. I planned accordingly and the my appliances were never delivered! No CALL or anything. It took me 4 different phone calls to reach an actual person. The delivery people could not be reached. I waited at the property until 10pm. I went to the store the next day and spoke with the manager, and apparently I was the 3rd customer complaining of no delivery and no notification. The store could not reach the delivery service because they were closed, and would not re-open again until that Tuesday after Christmas. I was told they "might" start calling customers then to attempt to re-schedule deliveries. I found this to be completely unprofessional and unacceptable. I cancelled my order and was refunded my money. I am showing my rental Wednesday and it will be empty. Home Depot has hurt my business.
